disruptive.null: Grant idea was proposed to the Members. The reward amount will be decided later.
disruptive.no_status: Grant idea was proposed to the Members. The reward amount will be decided later.
disruptive.proposed: Grant was proposed and now is being voted by Association members. Current vote is {{voteScore}} with {{votesAmount}} members voted. We are waiting for a quorum to accept/decline the grant.
disruptive.ready_to_apply: Grant is open for team applications. If you feel ready to implement the task, fill the form and send the application.
disruptive.rejected: Grant was rejected by the Association members. After voting the score is {{voteScore}}.
disruptive.team_chosen: The task performer was chosen by Association members. Waiting for the team {{performerName}} to start working on implementation.
disruptive.work_started: The task performer was chosen by Association members. Team {{performerName}} has started working on implementation.
disruptive.work_finished: The task was successfully completed by {{performerName}} team. The work result is accessible at link.

interhack.null: Hackathon was proposed by the Working Group. Details are to be discussed and will be published later.
interhack.no_status: Hackathon was proposed by the Working Group. Details are to be discussed and will be published later.
interhack.proposed: Hackathon task was proposed by the Working Group and is now voted by Association members. Current score is {{voteScore}} with {{votesAmount}} members voted so far.
interhack.ready_to_apply: Hackathon was approved by the Association. Teams are welcome to apply for a hackathon to join the participants list.
interhack.ready_to_submit: Team applications are closed. {{teamsAmount}} hackathon participants have been selected and are welcome to submit their solutions.
interhack.requests_selection_over: Team applications are closed. {{teamsAmount}} hackathon participants have been selected and are welcome to submit their solutions.
interhack.work_begun: Team applications are closed. {{teamsAmount}} hackathon participants have been selected and are welcome to submit their solutions.
interhack.work_started: Team applications are closed. {{teamsAmount}} hackathon participants have been selected and are welcome to submit their solutions.
interhack.work_finished: Submissions are closed. Solutions were collected from the participating teams and are now judged by jury.
interhack.solution_chosen: Hackathon is over! Winning team {{winnerIdentifier}} was chosen. Their solution was rewarded.
interhack.rejected: Task was rejected during the Association voting. It was declined by {{votesAmount}} members voted with the result score {{voteScore}}.

web3.null: Project was proposed by the applying team. The Working Group will research it and give feedback.
web3.no_status: Project was proposed by the applying team. The Working Group will research it and give feedback.
web3.voting_started: The Working Group researched the application and recommended it to the Association. DAO Members are voting on it. Current vote is {{voteScore}} with {{votesAmount}} members voted.
web3.approved: Project is approved by Association voting and will be granted.
web3.work_started: The team started implementing the task. Soon we will see the results.
web3.rejected: Project proposal was rejected by the Association. Details can be found on the Github page of the application.
web3.work_finished: The team completed the task and was granted by Waves Association.

desc.you_can_vote: Waves DAO is a tool that facilitates the application and distribution of grants provided by the Waves Association. Thanks to Waves DAO, members of the Waves Association and its working groups can manage the grant distribution process and transparently vote for applicants.
desc.select_category: Select a category to view grants

disruptive.title: Disruptive Tech Grants
disruptive.desc: Disruptive Tech Grants are awarded to implement tasks dedicated to developing solutions that meet the rapidly accelerating Waves ecosystem needs.
disruptive.banner: Call for applications will be announced in Q2 2021. Stay tuned!
disruptive.landing: Major development or research tasks are proposed, which can be useful for the development and adoption of blockchain technology. You and your team can apply for one of these grants and receive a reward.

web3.title: Web 3.0 Dev Grants
web3.desc: Web 3.0 Development Grants can be proposed by the community and awarded to the teams that foster mass adoption of blockchain technology.
web3.banner: Apply with your project before May 1, 2021 to receive grant of up to 100k WAVES
web3.landing: You propose ideas for grants of this type. Usually this is a decentralized application or startup.

interhack.title: Interhack Grants
interhack.desc: Interhack Grants are awarded for building innovative solutions at hackathons in accordance with assignments provided by the Waves Association.
interhack.banner: Join New Year Hackathon to participate in building cross-chain tools and compete for 12k WAVES prize pool
interhack.landing: These grants are as close as possible to the usual hackathon format. The Association puts forward an idea and a proposed a reward, and you with the team compete in implementation after being selected as a candidate

landing-page.howToDAO_2: Observe existing grants and voting statuses
landing-page.howToDAO_3: Become a member and participate in voting
landing-page.howToDAO_4: Apply for a grant with your project
landing-page.introDesc: Waves DAO is a framework used by the Waves Association. The purpose is making decisions on supporting initiatives and projects, based on the Waves protocol in the ecosystem: Waves Protocol, Gravity, Neutrino and others. The main feature is the transparency of processes. For example, you can observe what decisions are being discussed, who exactly is behind their adoption to finance projects, and also how the voting takes place.
landing-page.applicantDesc:
A user who can apply for a grant. If their application is approved by the DAO Member vote, the applicant will be awarded a Performer status.

In the Waves Association: all users submitting applications to execute a grant. To apply, users need a Waves account.
landing-page.workingGroupDesc:
A body composed of several DAO Members and dedicated to providing specific expertise and performing certain functions.

In the Waves Association: suggests a grant, accesses and validates incoming applications, proposes tasks for grants, opens / closes votes for teams, prepares reports. Currently, the working group includes 8 people.
landing-page.daoDesc:
DAO Members are all eligible members to vote for a decision on grant issue.

In the Waves Association: this entity represents the general meeting, which is the main entity that participates in votes and makes decisions. Currently the association has 30 members.
landing-page.daoManagerDesc:
This entity plays a supportive function, setting DAO Members and Working Group lists before grants distribution.

In the Waves Association, the DAO Manager represents the association’s secretary’s account. The DAO Manager does not participate in DAO votes.
landing-page.boardDesc:
A body composed of certain DAO Members who are performing the final validation function approves decisions made by DAO Members and accepts work of the Working Group.

In the Waves Association, the final approval body is the Board. The Board approves all solutions made by the general meeting.
landing-page.whyDAO_content_1: DAO attracts community members to participate in Waves ecosystem development processes, and keeps everyone on the same page
landing-page.whyDAO_content_2: Using DAO Association, members are following predefined steps to make the decisions with a simple UX and fast transactions
landing-page.whyDAO_content_3: Any internet user can observe decision making processes and stay sure that the decisions are made transparently and honestly
landing-page.workflow_description: As a preparation for launching a grant process, the DAO Manager sets the lists of Waves Association and Working Group members.
